CLUSTER_1_COMORBID_CONDITIONS.primary_question: Do you have any other diseases?

criteria.raw_text: Patients with psychoneuro-related diseases or history (such as depression, epilepsy), which affect medication compliance or the researcher's clinical judgment of suicide risk

conditions.SEVERITY: affects medication compliance OR suicide risk

criteria.raw_text: Known malignant tumors or history of malignant tumors (excluding clinically cured skin basal cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, cervical carcinoma in situ)
Peripheral artery disease diagnosed by angiography with stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic, including transient ischemic attack) should be excluded
Hospitalization due to cardiovascular events, cardiovascular disease or cardiovascular surgery
criteria.AMBIGUITY_NOTE: Timeframe not specified - unclear if any history or recent history

criteria.raw_text: There are severe arrhythmias that require medication or cardiac assistance, such as degree II type 2 or degree III atrioventricular block, long QT Interval, or long QT block
History of unstable angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, coronary artery bypass grafting or coronary stent implantation
criteria.AMBIGUITY_NOTE: Timeframe not specified - any history vs recent history unclear

criteria.raw_text: The presence of decompensated cardiac insufficiency (New York Heart Disease Association (NYHA) class III or IV) within 6 months prior to screening
The presence of other systemic autoimmune inflammatory diseases and skin lesions (such as eczema), which may affect the evaluation of treatment outcomes
Significant acute or chronic medical or psychiatric illness that could compromise subject safety, limit the subject's ability to complete the study, and/or compromise the objectives of the study

Any significant/uncontrolled neuropsychiatric illness judged as clinically significant by the investigator during screening or at Day 1, or any lifetime history of suicidal ideation, suicidal behavior, or suicidal attempts
Active gastrointestinal disease which could interfere with the absorption of oral medication
A condition which increases proarrhythmic risk, including hypokalemia, hypomagnesemia, or congenital Long QT Syndrome
History of epileptic seizures
History of severe gastrointestinal diseases or digestive system surgery within 3 months before screening
History of depression or suicidal tendencies
History of myocardial infarction or other specified cardiovascular events in the 6 months prior to study entry
Serious acute or chronic diseases of other vital organs within 1 year prior to screening
History of obstructive urinary tract diseases
History of urinary incontinence or anuria
History of acute kidney failure, kidney transplantation, or need for kidney transplantation or dialysis during the planned trial period
Mechanical operators engaged in high-altitude work, motor vehicle driving and other dangerous operations
Patients with a history of asthma or seizures
Patients with clinically significant major diseases or major surgical procedures within 3 months before the trial
A history of vomiting, diarrhea, or any physiological condition that could interfere with the test results within 7 days before the test

Patients with any disease that increases the risk of bleeding, such as active or previous history of gastrointestinal ulcer, gastrointestinal bleeding or perforation, ulcerative colitis, or intracranial hemorrhage

Patients with abnormal clinical manifestations that need to be excluded, including diseases of the nervous system, cardiovascular system, blood and lymphatic system, immune system, kidney, liver, gastrointestinal system, respiratory system, metabolic system, skeletal system and other systems
Previously diagnosed with serious mental illness such as anxiety, depression or suicidal tendency
A history of inflammatory bowel disease or other serious autoimmune disease
Any serious disease or medical measure, physical or mental condition that will affect the subject's participation in the trial or pose a significant risk or effect to the subject

Cancer (except for non-melanoma skin cancer, localized prostate cancer, ductal carcinoma in situ, stage I uterine cancer, cervical carcinoma in situ, or breast carcinoma in situ that have been treated with curative therapy) within 5 years before the first dose of this study
Have undergone a major surgery within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of this study or plan to undergo a major surgery during the study
History of major depressive disorder, suicidality, or suicidal tendency suggested by the C-SSRS at baseline or screening

Any clinically significant abnormal finding occurring during the screening period and/or observed at the baseline visit that may put the participant at risk due to their participation in the trial or could influence the participant's ability to complete the trial
Any disorder that is not stable and could affect the safety of the participant throughout the trial or impede the participant's ability to complete the trial

Any documented active or suspected malignancy, or history of malignancy within 5 years prior to screening, except basal cell carcinoma of the skin, localized squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, or in situ carcinoma of the cervix appropriately treated before the baseline visit
Major surgery within 8 weeks prior to screening or planned in-patient surgery or hospitalisation during the trial period
Subject has any clinically significant finding on 12-lead ECG at screening or admission
Any known history of a rheumatologic, autoimmune or cutaneous disease other than rheumatoid arthritis or psoriatic arthritis
Any known history of malignancy within 5 years other than completely treated non-metastatic basal cell carcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas of the skin or localized carcinoma in situ of the cervix
History of clinically significant medical conditions or any other reason that in the opinion of the PI would interfere with subject's participation in this study
Subject with symptoms of uninduced diarrhea within 3 months prior to screening
Subject with structural abnormalities of the digestive tract, or previous history of gastrointestinal disease or current clinically significant gastrointestinal disease
History of abdominal surgery affecting the structure and function of the digestive tract
Subject with previous severe or current chronic diseases of clinical significance, or any other diseases or medical conditions that may affect the study or pose an unacceptable risk to the subject
Has undergone any surgery in the 3 months prior to screening, or planned to undergo surgery during the study period

CLUSTER_2_TREATMENT_HISTORY.primary_question: Have you ever received any treatment for your disease?

criteria.raw_text: Subjects who are expected to receive additional local therapy, phototherapy, or other systemic therapy other than investigational medication during the trial
Previous participation in a piclidenoson (CF101) clinical trial
Ongoing or planned use of a concomitant medication that is on the CredibleMeds list of drugs known to cause Torsades des Pointes
Consuming any foods or drinks rich in caffeine/xanthine or other special ingredients from screening to -2 days of admission, or unable to stop eating the above foods or drinks during the trial

TIMEFRAME.relation: from screening to -2 days of admission

criteria.raw_text: Is taking or has ever taken an interleukin 17A/17F inhibitor or has participated in a bimekizumab investigational study
Is taking or has taken prohibited or restricted medications without meeting the mandatory discontinuation or stability period relative to the Baseline Visit
Ongoing use of prohibited treatments
Planned initiation or change in the use of an existing medication that can affect the efficacy evaluation for psoriasis

Prior use of etanercept within 4 weeks before the first dose of this study, or use of adalimumab and/or infliximab within 8 weeks before the first dose of this study, or prior use of another biologic within 12 weeks before the first dose of this study
Previously randomised in a clinical trial with delgocitinib
Treatment with any non-marketed drug substance within the last 4 weeks prior to baseline or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer
Treatment with any marketed biological therapy or investigational biologic agents within specified timeframes prior to baseline
criteria.AMBIGUITY_NOTE: Specified timeframes not detailed in raw text

criteria.raw_text: Receipt of excluded therapies including cell depleting therapy, prior tsDMARDs, prior immunomodulatory bDMARDs, or other conventional DMARDs within less than 5 half-lives prior to screening visit

An interval of less than 5 half-lives or 28 days from the last dose of a strong CYP1A2/CYP3A4 inhibitor or inducer, or a plan to use concurrently medications with strong CYP1A2/CYP3A4 inhibitory or inductive effect during study participation
Have received the prohibited treatment during the protocol required washout period
Use of topical treatments: corticosteroids, immunomodulators, anthralin, Vitamin D derivatives, retinoids, or coal tar (used on the body) within 1 week before the first dose of study drug
Use of cyclosporin, interferon, methotrexate, other systemic immunosuppressive or immunomodulating agents, or psoralen plus ultraviolet A within 8 weeks before the first dose of study drug
Use of oral retinoids within 12 weeks before the first dose of study drug
Use of biologic agents known or expected to impact the course of psoriasis or its assessments within 12 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) before the first dose of study drug
Prior exposure to golimumab or another non-TNFi biologic; prior exposure to a TYK2i is acceptable, but cannot be used during course of the study

EXCEPTION_CONDITION.condition: prior exposure acceptable, but not during study

criteria.raw_text: Participants who have ever received biologic immunomodulating agents for psoriatic arthritis or plaque psoriasis whether investigational or approved, except for those targeting TNFα
History of lack of response to any therapeutic agent targeted to IL-12, IL-17 or IL-23 at approved doses after at least 3 months of therapy
Participants must not have received any medication that is specifically prohibited
Participants must not have had any prior exposure to deucravacitinib

Subjects who have received topical medication for psoriasis within 14 days before baseline, or systemic medication or phototherapy for psoriasis within 28 days before baseline, or biological agents for psoriasis within a specified time before baseline
criteria.AMBIGUITY_NOTE: Specified time for biological agents not detailed

criteria.raw_text: Has received within 2 weeks of the first dose any prescribed anticoagulant, including but not limited to coumarins, factor Xa inhibitors, heparins, and direct thrombin inhibitors
Has received within 12 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of the first dose other biologic therapy or experimental antibody, any agent that modulates T-cells
Has received within 2 weeks of the first dose any topical medications for psoriasis or other conditions that could impact assessment of psoriasis

Has received within 4 weeks of the first dose any systemic immunosuppressives for the treatment of psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis, or any other indications that could impact the assessment of psoriasis
Has received within 12 weeks of the first dose any prior biologic for the treatment of psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis, or any other indications that could impact the assessment of psoriasis
